intro: Psychotria membranifolia, commonly known as the "Bladderleaf Psychotria," is a member of the Rubiaceae family, native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows up to 3 meters in height, featuring opposite, elliptical leaves with a leathery texture. The plant produces small, white to greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, followed by small, fleshy, bladder-like fruits that are characteristic of the species. Psychotria membranifolia is known for its chemical complexity, containing various alkaloids, some of which have been studied for their potential pharmacological properties.
